contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=July 2012}} Italian [[tourist]] '''Orfeo Bartolini''', 51, was murdered in [[Afghanistan]] in April 2003.<ref> {{cite news |title=Ucciso un italiano in Afghanistan |date=11 April 2003 |language=Italian |newspaper=[[Corriere della sera]]|trans_title=An Italian killed in Afghanistan |url=http://www.corriere.it/Primo_Piano/Esteri/2003/04_Aprile/11/afghanistan.shtml}}</ref> Bartolini left his home in [[Rimini]], [[Italy]] on March 17, 2003 and set out on by motorcycle for [[India]], where he planned to visit the tomb of [[Mother Teresa]]. On April 10, his motorcycle broke down in the Shahjoi district of Zabul province, [[Afghanistan]]. He hired a car to take him to [[Kabul]]. On the way, the car was stopped by two men on a motorbike, who then shot Bartolini. Though the area was a known stronghold of the [[Taliban]], looking to regroup following their removal as leaders of the Afghan government by American and allied forces, Italian ambassador [[Dominico Georgi]] originally declared that robbery may be the cause of Bartolini's murder. However, as the Italian's Afghan driver was unhurt in the attack and no robbery was reported, Taliban dissidents remained the chief suspects. The week after the killing, eight Taliban fighters were captured by Afghan soldiers investigating Bartolini's murder in the [[Sur Ghar]] area of the country. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=46404702}} {{Persondata | NAME = Bartolini, Orfeo | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1952 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 2003 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bartolini, Orfeo}} [[Category:1952 births]] [[Category:2003 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths by firearm in Afghanistan]] [[Category:Italian people murdered abroad]] [[Category:People from Rimini]] [[Category:People murdered in Afghanistan]] [[Category:Afghanistanâ€“Italy relations]] {{Italy-bio-stub}}
